notes: Democratic congressional candidate struck by pepper bullets
outcome: pepper ball strike
outcome_detail: pepper ball strike
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: death
notes: First known death during Trump ICE raid. Fell 30 feet from greenhouse roof at Glass House Farms cannabis facility while hiding/fleeing. Broke neck. ~200 arrested, 10 minors found. DHS says he wasn't 'pursued' but family says he was hiding. GoFundMe raised $150k+.
outcome_detail: death
jurisdiction_notes: Ventura County. Site of ICE detention facility deaths.

outcome: 2 deaths, 1 injured
notes: Shooter Joshua Jahn fired from rooftop into ICE facility sally port, hitting 3 detainees in van. 1 died on scene, 1 died 6 days later. Jahn killed self. NOT an ICE shooting - attack on ICE.
outcome_detail: 2 deaths, 1 injured

outcome: 1 officer injured
notes: Attack on Prairieland ICE Detention Center. 12 individuals allegedly used fireworks to lure officers, then ambushed. Person in green mask fired rifle from woods. Alvarado police officer shot in neck, released same day.
outcome_detail: 1 officer injured
jurisdiction_notes: Site of multiple ICE enforcement operations.

outcome: detained, vehicle window broken
notes: ICE broke car window and 'forced him out of vehicle when he tried to exercise his rights'. Founding member of Familias Unidas por la Justicia. Sparked 300-person protest at Tacoma NWDC on Mar 27.
outcome_detail: detained, vehicle window broken

outcome: 8 detained, at least 3 deported to Mexico
notes: Armed CBP agents raided Vermont dairy farm. Largest single immigration arrest of farmworkers in recent Vermont history. Ages 22-41. Rattled VT $5.4B dairy industry (94% of dairies hire migrant workers). Governor Scott issued statement calling migrants essential.
outcome_detail: 8 detained, at least 3 deported to Mexico

outcome: detained, ICE agent held in contempt
notes: Defendant arrested by ICE immediately after stepping outside courthouse following first day of trial. Judge Mark Summerville held ICE agent Brian Sullivan in contempt for 'knowingly and intentionally preventing the defendant's appearance at an ongoing jury trial.'
outcome_detail: detained, ICE agent held in contempt
jurisdiction_notes: Trust Act + local policy.

outcome: arrested at Target, detained 9 months
notes: VERIFIED per CNN/Colorado Sun: March 17, 2025 at ~11 AM, Jeanette Vizguerra arrested by ICE on lunch break outside Target store. Agent said 'We finally got you' while chaining her; agents 'were laughing.' Day before she spoke against Trump at Denver Capitol protest. Vizguerra gained fame 2017 church sanctuary, Time 100 Most Influential. Detained at GEO Aurora. Released Dec 22, 2025 on $5,000 bond after 9 months. Lawyers argued targeting violated free speech rights.
outcome_detail: arrested outside Target, detained 9 months at GEO Aurora, released Dec 22 on $5,000 bond
jurisdiction_notes: Denver suburb. Under Colorado HB19-1124. Site of Aurora ICE detention facility.

outcome: peaceful interfaith vigil
notes: Kickoff event for Communities Not Cages National Day of Action. 100 people gathered outside former Dublin Women's Prison (closed 2024) being proposed to reopen as ICE detention center.
outcome_detail: peaceful interfaith vigil

outcome: coordinated national protests
notes: Communities Not Cages National Day of Action: 17 in-person demonstrations and 2 virtual actions across 13 states + DC. Cities included LA, Phoenix, Denver, Atlanta, NYC, Aurora, Fort Worth, Oklahoma City, Tulsa, Grand Rapids, New Orleans, Elizabeth NJ. 100+ supporting orgs. Individual city protests tracked in separate records (T4-017 etc).
outcome_detail: coordinated national protests

outcome: peaceful rally
notes: Nearly 100 people rallied outside ICE field office in downtown Atlanta as part of Communities Not Cages National Day of Action. Speakers included Uche Onwa (Black Diaspora Liberty Initiative).
outcome_detail: peaceful rally
jurisdiction_notes: City attempted sanctuary-like policies; constrained by state law.

outcome: protest after judge arrest
notes: VERIFIED per NPR/CBS/Fox6: April 25, 2025 FBI arrested Judge Hannah Dugan on obstruction charges for allegedly helping Eduardo Flores-Ruiz exit through back door to avoid ICE agents on April 18. Hundreds protested outside Milwaukee courthouse April 26. Wisconsin Supreme Court suspended Dugan April 29. Dec 18, 2025: Federal jury found Dugan guilty of felony obstruction but not guilty of misdemeanor concealment.
outcome_detail: protest after judge arrest

outcome: peaceful protest
notes: Dozens of protesters gathered in front of CoreCivic detention center in Elizabeth, protesting conditions and planned opening of Delaney Hall (1,000-bed facility, $1B 15-year GEO Group contract).
outcome_detail: peaceful protest

outcome: peaceful coalition protest
notes: VERIFIED per ABC7 NY/WHYY: March 11, 2025 coalition of 30+ faith-based orgs, labor unions, and immigrant rights groups protested imminent reopening of Delaney Hall as ICE detention. Facility reopened May 1, 2025 under $1B/15-year GEO Group contract. Mayor Baraka arrested May 9 at subsequent protest.
outcome_detail: peaceful coalition protest
jurisdiction_notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.

outcome: 4 officers injured (3 by rocks, 1 shoulder + spit on), 13 arrested
notes: Protest started at TX Capitol, moved downtown. Protesters threw 'very large rocks' at officers. APD deployed pepper balls, DPS deployed CS tear gas. Gov. Abbott deployed National Guard. 8 APD arrests (2 for graffiti), 5 DPS arrests (3 felony criminal mischief). All 4 officers treated at hospital and released.
outcome_detail: 4 officers injured (3 by rocks, 1 shoulder + spit on), 13 arrested
jurisdiction_notes: Historically immigrant-friendly but constrained by TX SB4. APD contacted ICE 33 times Jan-Sept 2025. Chief Davis: 'to me, means it's a sanctuary city' but cannot prohibit ICE contact.

outcome: 21 arrested, 4 officers injured
notes: Protesters clashed with police outside ICE facility. Ages 25-69 arrested, charged with obstruction/disorderly conduct. Part of ~80 total arrests since early October when Illinois State Police set up designated protest zones. Mayor issued Civil Emergency Order Nov 17.
outcome_detail: 21 arrested, 4 officers injured
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: 44 arrested, ICE office closed for day
notes: 200+ faith leaders (ministers, rabbis, imams) chained themselves to ICE building entrances starting 6:30am. Blocked entrance for ~5 hours. SF Fire Dept cut chains. Organized by Interfaith Movement for Human Integrity. DHS called them 'rioters' but reporters described 'mostly peaceful protest.'
outcome_detail: 44 arrested, ICE office closed for day
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated sanctuary jurisdiction Aug 2025.

outcome: multiple arrests, extreme force
notes: 'A Night of Terror: Civil Disobedience Met With Extreme Force at Portland ICE Facility' - Portland Mercury headline. Part of near-nightly protests since June 9. FBI claims 128 arrests since June 9 with 27 active investigations. Many arrested never informed of reason or read rights.
outcome_detail: multiple arrests, extreme force
jurisdiction_notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.

outcome: 575 total protest-related arrests since June 7
notes: LAPD made 575 protest-related arrests since June 7, including 14 for looting. Trump deployed 4,000 CA National Guard + 700 Marines (later ruled illegal violation of Posse Comitatus by Judge Breyer on Sep 3). David Huerta (SEIU CA president) arrested, charged with felony conspiracy to impede officer, $50k bond. Judge Frimpong ruled on July 11 admin likely violated immigrants' rights. Prosecutors failed to secure indictments for majority after DHS agents found to have made false statements.
outcome_detail: 575 total protest-related arrests since June 7
jurisdiction_notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

outcome: ~100 clergy arrested protesting deportation flights
notes: Part of 'ICE Out' day of action. ~100 members of clergy arrested at Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport protesting deportation flights. Charged with misdemeanor trespassing and failure to comply with peace officer. Same day 700+ MN businesses closed for 'economic blackout'.
outcome_detail: ~100 clergy arrested protesting deportation flights
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

outcome: 3 arrested including prominent civil rights attorney
notes: Protesters entered Cities Church in St. Paul where an ICE official serves as pastor. Nekima Levy Armstrong (prominent civil rights attorney) arrested on federal charges of 'conspiracy to deprive others of their rights' (religious rights). Journalist initially detained but not charged.
outcome_detail: 3 arrested including prominent civil rights attorney

outcome: 700+ businesses closed, thousands protested in freezing cold
notes: Statewide 'economic blackout' and general strike. 700+ MN businesses closed. Thousands picketed in freezing cold. Federal agents used tear gas and pepper spray against protesters. Governor Walz placed National Guard on standby. Part of largest coordinated protest action in MN history.
outcome_detail: 700+ businesses closed, thousands protested in freezing cold

outcome: 6 arrests, total 79 ICE protest-related arrests to date
notes: Portland Police monitored protest activity near ICE facility. 6 targeted arrests made. Brings total ICE protest-related arrests in Portland to 79 since June 2025.
outcome_detail: 6 arrests, total 79 ICE protest-related arrests to date
jurisdiction_notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.

outcome: ~200 detained in tunnel, 1 arrested for firearm possession
notes: Feb 2-3 protests shut down 101 freeway. Feb 2: thousands marched from Olvera St to City Hall, blocked freeway. Feb 3: LAPD declared unlawful assembly after bottles/rocks thrown. ~200 detained in tunnel at 200 block Cesar Chavez Ave. Firework shot at police helicopter. San Bernardino protest same day used tear gas and BearCats.
outcome_detail: ~200 detained in tunnel, 1 arrested for firearm possession
jurisdiction_notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

city: Los Angeles (Hollywood Home Depot / Dodger Stadium)
outcome: detained, taken to Dodger Stadium processing, released
notes: US citizen detained by Border Patrol/ICE. Agent said 'I got another one' - Garcia understood as racially charged. Taken in van to Dodger Stadium with other arrestees. Agents confirmed he was US citizen with no warrants but continued to hold him. Heard agents boasting about 'bodies' they had gotten. MALDEF representing.
outcome_detail: detained, taken to Dodger Stadium processing, released
jurisdiction_notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

outcome: shot in face and body with pepper balls, briefly lost consciousness
notes: VERIFIED per Block Club/CBS/CNN: Protester shot in face and body with pepper balls by agents on Broadview ICE facility roof around 6pm, briefly lost consciousness. Part of Operation Midway Blitz (Sep 8 - Oct 3). Oct 9, 2025: Judge Ellis issued TRO against agents' use of tear gas/pepper balls on journalists and peaceful protesters.
outcome_detail: shot in face and body with pepper balls, briefly lost consciousness
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: journalist shot in face with pepper spray projectile
notes: Journalist who attended 2 dozen+ protests shot in face with pepper spray projectile. Said 'I have never seen anything like this response in my life.' Federal judge later ruled agents can't use tear gas/pepper spray on journalists after Block Club Chicago and others sued. Second incident - first was Sept 19 (T2-LL-004).
outcome_detail: journalist shot in face with pepper spray projectile
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: 11 arrested, 4 federal charges, tear gas deployed
notes: Federal officers used tear gas, pepper balls, flash bang grenades. 11 arrested, 4 charged federally with assaulting/resisting officers. Mayor Thompson: 'relentless deployment of tear gas, pepper spray, mace, and rubber bullets' endangering residents. Gov. Pritzker accused Trump admin of trying to destabilize Chicago.
outcome_detail: 11 arrested, 4 federal charges, tear gas deployed
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: 4 farmworkers detained on way to blueberry farm
notes: VERIFIED per OPB/Salem Reporter: August 7, 2025 ~6am, ICE stopped van in Marion County, broke driver's window, detained 4 Guatemalan Mam Nation farmworkers heading from Woodburn to Canby blueberry farm. 3 men, 1 woman arrested; 2 women and teenage girl released. Largest ICE arrest in Woodburn area since January 2025. Attorneys filed emergency habeas petition.
outcome_detail: 4 farmworkers detained on way to blueberry farm

outcome: 7 workers detained at farm where UFW was organizing
notes: VERIFIED per Investigative Post/UFW/Daily Kos: August 14, 2025 second ICE raid at Lynn-Ette Farms (Orleans County NY), 7 workers detained. UFW certified bargaining rep since 2022. First raid May 2, 2025 detained 14 (10 deported, 4 released on bond) - included Guatemalan family leading union efforts. Farm owner refuses to implement state-arbitrator-awarded union contract. UFW believes raids connected to labor organizing.
outcome_detail: 7 workers detained at farm where UFW was organizing

outcome: tackled and arrested by federal agents while reporting
notes: Journalist tackled and arrested by federal agents while reporting on protests. Press Freedom Tracker documented incident. Judge later issued injunction forbidding agents from using force against journalists without probable cause.
outcome_detail: tackled and arrested by federal agents while reporting
jurisdiction_notes: ICE Detention Center location in sanctuary state. Frequent protest site.

outcome: pepper spray shot directly into eyes
notes: Reporter described: 'In a literal second, the agent pulled out his pepper gel, sprayed the protester next to me, and then shot a stream straight into my eyes.' At least one protester detained, two people including journalist pepper sprayed.
outcome_detail: pepper spray shot directly into eyes
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated sanctuary jurisdiction Aug 2025.

outcome: detained 8 hours, bruised, phone confiscated, later received AI-voice death threats
notes: July 2, 2025: Barbara Stone, 71, observing ICE in hallway outside San Diego immigration court. Raised phone to video arrest of immigrant. ICE agent claimed Stone pushed her (Stone denies). Agents chased her, cornered her in stairwell, handcuffed. Held 8 hours without lawyer despite ~15 requests. Phone confiscated as 'weapon' - still not returned 2 months later. DHS called it 'assault.' After national news coverage, husband received AI-modified voice death threat. Family added security lights.
outcome_detail: detained 8 hours, bruised, phone confiscated, AI-voice death threats
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated. Border county with complex dynamics.

outcome: lawsuit filed, residents suffered respiratory distress, PTSD
notes: Lawsuit filed against DHS. Plaintiffs claim officers deployed pepper balls and CS gas 'toward and around' low-income housing complex 'repeatedly when faced with no violence from protesters.' Nearby residents suffered acute respiratory distress, ocular burning, PTSD episodes. 660+ arrested in Oregon in 2025. Sen. Merkley called raids 'terrorizing our communities.'
outcome_detail: lawsuit filed, residents suffered respiratory distress, PTSD
jurisdiction_notes: Police prohibited from immigration enforcement since 1987.

outcome: death
notes: Second person to die fleeing SoCal raids. Fled Home Depot during ICE operation, ran across eastbound I-210 freeway, struck by SUV going ~60mph. Suffered major injuries, died at hospital. Identified by National Day Laborer Organizing Network. Vigil held at site.
outcome_detail: death

outcome: death
notes: Was heading to gardening job when vehicle pulled over by ICE. Agents tried to detain him and 3 other passengers. Fled on foot, tried to cross I-264, fatally struck. Had been in US 4 years, working to send money to family in Honduras.
outcome_detail: death
jurisdiction_notes: Virginia has no statewide policy. Norfolk generally cooperative.

outcome: arrested while escorting defendant from immigration court
notes: NYC Comptroller and mayoral candidate arrested by masked federal agents at 26 Federal Plaza while escorting defendant from immigration court. DHS charged him with 'assaulting law enforcement and impeding a federal court officer.' Video shows him led away in handcuffs. Part of pattern - at least 5 elected officials arrested/confronted in 2025.
outcome_detail: arrested while escorting defendant from immigration court
jurisdiction_notes: Executive Order 41 (2003, expanded). Strongest municipal protections.

outcome: arrested without warrant near home
notes: Arrested by ICE without warrant near his home 'coming back from buying tamales for the family.' Part of federal court action by 22 people challenging unlawful warrantless arrests.
outcome_detail: arrested without warrant near home

outcome: US citizen detained 10+ hours then released
notes: US citizen from Chicago detained by ICE for more than 10 hours in late January, then released. Part of federal court action by 22 people challenging unlawful warrantless arrests.
outcome_detail: US citizen detained 10+ hours then released
jurisdiction_notes: Welcoming City Ordinance. Site of numerous 2025 enforcement operations.

outcome: 12 arrested at restaurant without warrants
notes: Twelve people arrested in single incident at a restaurant in Liberty, Missouri, without warrants or probable cause. Part of federal court action challenging unlawful warrantless arrests.
outcome_detail: 12 arrested at restaurant without warrants
jurisdiction_notes: Kansas City suburb. Missouri has no statewide policy.

outcome: smoke device used to disperse crowd at taco restaurant
notes: ICE agents used smoke device to disperse crowd near Buona Forchetta taco restaurant. Council member Sean Elo-Rivera: 'It got out of control because of the way they showed up.' Protesters chanted 'Abolish ICE!' Federal officials later said it was a criminal investigation, not immigration raid.
outcome_detail: smoke device used to disperse crowd at taco restaurant
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated. Border county with complex dynamics.

outcome: death
notes: Found unresponsive in ICE custody. Part of 2025 being deadliest year since 2004 (31 deaths). ICE holding ~68,440 people (78% increase from 2024). Inspections dropped 36.25% as detentions soared.
outcome_detail: death
jurisdiction_notes: Location of Robert A. Deyton Detention Center (Clayton County).

outcome: ICE raided construction site in Uptown Charlotte on North Tryon Street. Workers detained during tall building construction project.
correction_notes: Real raid occurred June 13, 2025 (not April). Later Operation Charlotte's Web in November 2025 detained 250+.

outcome: Jamaican immigrant McIntosh, who overstayed B2 tourist visa by 3+ years, was involved in 3 hit-and-runs. Officer Mathers attempted to detain him. McIntosh assaulted her, striking her multiple times. She deployed taser but he removed probes and continued attacking until bystanders intervened. Officer injured, McIntosh arrested.
correction_notes: Original entry completely reversed the facts. Real incident: immigrant McIntosh assaulted Officer Mathers during hit-and-run stop; she tased him in self-defense. Entry incorrectly portrayed it as ICE agent violence against immigrant.

outcome: Operation Buckeye: 214+ detained December 17-23 including restaurant workers. 80% Latino, 2 US citizens wrongfully detained.
correction_notes: Real operation was 'Operation Buckeye' with 214+ detained, not 33 at food distribution center.

notes: VERIFIED per Indiana Capital Chronicle/WRTV/WTHR: Apartment complex ICE raids confirmed by Miguel Avila (Indiana Assistance to Immigrants in Detention): 'In the place I live, apartment complex, they've been raid by ICE agents. They're breaking families apart.' Nearly 1,400 ICE arrests in Indiana Jan 20-Jun 26, 2025 (~80% increase). 55 of 300 June arrests had no criminal charges. Gov. Braun signed Jan 28, 2025 executive order mandating full state ICE cooperation.
outcome: Apartment complex raids reported in Indianapolis area. Nearly 1,400 arrests in Indiana since Jan 20, 2025 (80% increase over prior year).
Army veteran detained 8 hours, no charges
notes: 39-year-old US citizen, Army veteran (2004-2009, Iraq 2006-2007), Purple Heart recipient. Tackled while standing on sidewalk observing ICE detention. Denied phone call or attorney. DHS claimed 'assault' but no charges filed. Incident blocks from where Renee Good was shot.
outcome_detail: Army veteran detained 8 hours, no charges
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ investigation opened Jan 2026 into Mayor Frey. Site of Operation Tidal Wave with 2000+ federal officers.

outcome: US citizen family detained for speaking Spanish
notes: 3-year-old toddler, mother, grandmother - all US citizens born in Puerto Rico. Detained while shopping after being overheard speaking Spanish. Not allowed to present ID until at detention center. ICE apologized but refused to drive them back.
outcome_detail: US citizen family detained for speaking Spanish

outcome: disabled Army veteran detained 4 months, ruled unlawful
notes: Disabled Army veteran, LPR since 2001, National Guard 2001-2005. Uses wheelchair. Detained at citizenship interview. Judge ruled detention unlawful, US Attorney apologized. Went 4 months without ophthalmologist despite thyroid eye disease. President of Veterans for Peace chapter.
outcome_detail: disabled Army veteran detained 4 months, ruled unlawful
jurisdiction_notes: Site of Northwest Detention Center (now Northwest ICE Processing Center). State has Keep Washington Working Act.

victim_name: Romeo and siblings (3 US citizen children)
outcome: 3 US citizen children deported to Honduras
notes: April 25, 2025: Romeo (4, US citizen, Stage 4 kidney cancer metastasized to lungs, was receiving treatment at Manning Family Children's Hospital NO), Ruby (7, US citizen), and Jade (2, US citizen) deported to Honduras with mothers Julia and Rosario. Mothers showed up at check-in with passports per ICE instructions. Held incommunicado, denied counsel. Julia signed consent under threat Jade would go to foster care. Romeo now must travel US-Honduras for cancer care. Lawsuit J.L.V. v. Acuna filed July 31 in M.D. Louisiana.
outcome_detail: 3 US citizen children deported to Honduras

outcome: Iranian grandmother detained while gardening
notes: Iranian grandmother, lived in US nearly 50 years, no criminal record. Detained by ICE while gardening outside home. Released after nearly 3 weeks when House Majority Leader Scalise and State Rep. Hilferty intervened.
outcome_detail: Iranian grandmother detained while gardening

outcome: 73-year-old grandmother detained at routine check-in
notes: 73-year-old grandmother with legal status. Faithfully reported to ICE every 6 months for 13+ years. Detained at routine check-in in SF, transferred to Fresno then Bakersfield in handcuffs (arrived 3am). No criminal record. 10,000+ signed petition for release.
outcome_detail: 73-year-old grandmother detained at routine check-in

outcome: 12+ detained at Italian restaurant, flash bangs used
notes: Buona Forchetta restaurant. 20+ masked agents in military gear. Investigation began after 2020/2025 tips. 47.5% of workforce had fraudulent green cards. Flash bangs used to disperse crowd. Mayor Gloria called it 'deeply upsetting.' All 7 locations closed temporarily.
outcome_detail: 12+ detained at Italian restaurant, flash bangs used
jurisdiction_notes: DOJ designated. Border county with complex dynamics.

outcome: 12+ workers detained at Chinese buffet
notes: Golden Apple Buffet. Workers from China, Mexico, Indonesia. Agents used battering rams to enter employee housing. Two workers showering when agents pointed guns at them. Owners charged with 'bringing in and harboring aliens.' Restaurant reopened Sep 23.
outcome_detail: 12+ workers detained at Chinese buffet

outcome: Mayor arrested, charges later dropped
notes: Mayor Ras Baraka arrested by 12-20 ICE/HSI officers outside newly opened Delaney Hall. Three members of Congress present (Reps. Menendez, McIver, Watson Coleman). Protesters formed human shield. Rep. McIver later charged with assaulting federal officer. Baraka charges dropped.
outcome_detail: Mayor arrested, charges later dropped
jurisdiction_notes: Mayor Ras Baraka publicly defied ICE Jan 2025.

outcome: Construction site raid, 250+ arrested across Charlotte area
notes: VERIFIED: ICE raid on construction site at North Tryon St in uptown Charlotte on June 13, 2025. Confirmed by Charlotte Alerts News.
outcome_detail: 250+ arrested, construction industry devastated
jurisdiction_notes: North Carolina - no sanctuary protections. Governor cooperating with federal enforcement.

outcome: 30 detained at factory
notes: Federal agents arrested 30 people at Kings Mountain factory during workplace enforcement operation led by ICE. Part of ramped up activity across Charlotte area.
outcome_detail: 30 detained at factory
jurisdiction_notes: North Carolina - no sanctuary protections.

outcome: 8 construction workers arrested at worksite
notes: ICE agents arrested 8 construction workers at worksite near Eastern and Ogden avenues. Nevada Immigration Coalition reported 100 ICE agents in Las Vegas Valley until Easter. Many enforcement activities in morning at construction sites. Nevada has largest per capita undocumented population of any state - 9% of workforce.
outcome_detail: 8 construction workers arrested
jurisdiction_notes: Nevada - largest per capita undocumented population in US.

outcome: US citizen detained twice in workplace raids, filed federal lawsuit
notes: Leonardo Garcia Venegas, US citizen and construction worker, detained TWICE by immigration agents within weeks. Video shows him forced to ground repeatedly insisting he was citizen. Agents targeted workers who 'looked Latino'. Released after more than an hour. Filed federal lawsuit demanding end to workplace raids, alleging Fourth Amendment violation.
outcome_detail: US citizen detained twice, federal lawsuit filed
jurisdiction_notes: Alabama - aggressive cooperation with federal immigration enforcement.

outcome: US citizen detained, held at Dodger Stadium with other detainees
notes: Job Garcia, US citizen from Los Angeles, detained by Border Patrol agents. As transferred to another agent, heard first agent say 'I got another one'. Taken in van to Dodger Stadium with other men arrested that afternoon. Although agents confirmed he was US citizen with no warrants, they continued to hold him. MALDEF filed Federal Tort Claims Act claim.
outcome_detail: US citizen detained despite confirmation of citizenship
jurisdiction_notes: Special Order 40 (1979) - oldest major city sanctuary policy.

outcome: US citizen Iraq veteran detained 3 days, placed on suicide watch
notes: George Retes, 26-year-old US citizen and Iraq combat veteran born and raised in Ventura, California. ICE agents broke his car window at roadblock. Wrongfully detained, stripped of rights, held down by officers kneeling on neck and back, jailed 3 days, placed on suicide watch - without explanation, charges, or apology.
outcome_detail: US citizen Iraq veteran detained 3 days without charges
jurisdiction_notes: California Values Act protections.
